Incident.Summary: Responded to I-83 near old Pimlico for an individual laying in the grass. Further investigation determines incident was a verbal family disturbance.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: MSP MARKED VEHICLE R-42 NOT EQUIPPEDWITH MVR // INCIDENT WAS CAPTURED ON TROOPERS BWCVIDEO REQUEST CAN BE MADE TO SGT. TWARDOWSKI AT (JOSEPH.TWARDOWSKI@MARYLAND.GOV) font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> SCENE PROCESSING/PHYSICAL EVIDENCE: font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> -N/A font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> ATTACHMENTS: -N/A font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> Male- font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> Michael John Wallace DOB: 07/23/1962 6776 Marvin Ave Eldersburg, Maryland 21784 Female- font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> Carol Wallace DOB: 09/21/1961 6776 Marvin Ave Eldersburg, Maryland 21784 font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> On Sunday, October 1st, 2023, I, TFC. Howard #7278, of the Maryland State Police was on routine patrol, in full uniform, operating my marked Ford Explorer police vehicle. At approximately 1108 hours, I received a call for a male pedestrian walking on the right shoulder of I-83 in between Ruxton Road and Northern Parkway. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> Upon my arrival at approximately 1118 hours, I observed a white male, wearing a grey t-shirt, grey sweatpants who I identified as Michael John Wallace, DOB: 07/23/1962 sitting in the grass. I introduced myself to him then questioned him on why was he sitting there. Medics were requested precautionary to evaluate Mr. Wallace. He told me he, his wife and son were traveling to the Baltimore zoo to drop off their autistic son for activities. He and his son engaged in a verbal altercation. It became heated, so his wife offered him to exit the vehicle to defuse the situation, take their son to the zoo then come back to retrieve Mr. Wallace. Medical personnel arrived at the scene to evaluate Mr. Wallace. After being evaluated it was determined no medical attention was needed. Mrs. Wallace was contacted via telephone. She informed us she took their son to the zoo and is now en-route to the scene. Once on scene, I identified her as Carol Wallace DOB: 09/21/196. She was interviewed and confirmed what Mr. Wallace informed me initially. She made it very clear at no point did anything become physical. Both parties were informed to attempt to find a safer solution in the future if an incident were to spike again. The two expressed their extreme gratitude and appreciation for our services. Both Mr. and Mrs. Wallace was on their way without further incident. I request this case to be closed. All above events occurred in Baltimore County, Maryland.
